definition: general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
nickname of Han dynasty general Li Guang 李廣|李广[Li3 Guang3]
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
lit. to choose a general among the dwarves (idiom)/fig. to pick the best out of a bad group
pinyin: cuo2 zi5 li3 ba2 jiang1 jun1

definition: lit. choose a general from among the dwarfs/fig. choose the best person available (out of a mediocre bunch)
pinyin: ai3 zi5 li5 ba2 jiang1 jun1

definition: lit. General Iron is guarding the door (idiom)/fig. the door is padlocked — nobody inside

sentences.english: The Chu general Zhuang Jiao entered the region from the upper Yangtze River and set himself up as "King of Dian".
sentences.chinese: 楚国的将军庄郊从长江上游来到这里自称滇王。

sentences.english: General Zhang Xueliang is a typical representative of patriotism in modern Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 张学良将军是中国近现代史上爱国主义的典型代表。
奥德耶诺将军赞扬了这一事态进展。

sentences.english: Commander-in-chief that Eastern Jin set up has intimate relations with generals.
sentences.chinese: 东晋国家设置的都督诸州军事与将军职有密切的关系。

sentences.english: But the liver of Hepatitis B disobeys the virtue of General.
sentences.chinese: 故乙肝病人其肝大违将军之德。

sentences.english: Chengren the success of the General Liming Ding.
The next morning they were summoned to see the commanding general.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，将军召见他们。

sentences.english: Former Bosnian Serb general Ratko Mladic spent sixteen years in hiding.
sentences.chinese: 前波斯尼亚塞族将军姆拉迪奇藏匿花了十六年。

sentences.english: The general commanded his men to attack the city.
The general swore to take back this island whatever the cost.
sentences.chinese: 我位将军发誓不惜任何代价夺回这个岛。

sentences.english: The British had departed New York, and the general bade farewell to his men.
sentences.chinese: 当时，英军已撤离纽约，将军也与部下道别。

sentences.english: The general infiltrated spies into China.
sentences.chinese: 将军曾派间谍进入中国。

sentences.english: The general's speech was pitched as a call to arms.
sentences.chinese: 将军的讲话是一个要大家拿起武器的号召。

sentences.english: Caesar was the general of Rome.
sentences.chinese: 恺撒是罗马的盖世将军。
华盛顿是位著名的将军。

definition: (army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
senior official/senior officer/commanding officer/CL:位[wei4]/sir (term of address for senior officer)
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
